title: rJ8X2VT7M
content: This paper introduces an information theoretic co-training objective for unsupervised learning, focusing on predicting future sensations through hypotheses confirmed by future sensations. It trains predictor model $P_\Phi(z|x)$ and confirmation model $P_\Psi(z|y)$ to measure mutual information between past sensation $x$ and future sensation $y. The training objective aims to maximize mutual information between $x$ and $z$ under the distribution defined by the confirmation model $P_\Psi(z|y). The training objective involves model $P_\Psi(z|y)$ to match predictions from $x$ with confirmations from $y. Experiments are conducted on phonetics learning using the TIMIT dataset.
